page.title: 20Bus trip - Culcheth to Leigh
page.content: First you walk to a bus stop. This is a metal post about two metres high, with a square metal sign at the top. There is usually a timetable fastened onto it. This is a piece of paper with the times that buses run, so you can work out how long you've got to wait. As you get on you have to pay the required fare to the driver. Buses used to have a second man called a conductor to collect the fares, but buses hardly ever have them now. The journey is quite bumpy but apart from that it's okay! It takes about 12 minutes to get to Leigh, depending on the traffic, with about 7 bus stops on the way.{ {Sarah Bennett,Mark Lomas,Sarah Seddon} { {Data compiled by Twiss Green C.P. and {Newchurch C.P. Schools and Glazebury {C.E. School.}
